      Method that is used to show an alert to the user.

      Method that will update the view by polling the algorithm, it will also update the view to disable buttons and such thus that the current state of the scheduler is reflected in the view.

      Method that starts the timer on the GUI
      private void stop()

    • Method Detail

      • setAlgorithmThread

        public void setAlgorithmThread(VisualAlgorithm thread)
        Sets the algorithm to be run
        Parameters:
        thread - algorithm to be run

      • setScheduler

        public void setScheduler(Scheduler scheduler)
        Sets the scheduler
        Parameters:
        scheduler - which contains the current state of the application.

      • setTaskMap

        public void setTaskMap(java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,Task> taskMap)
        Sets the task information map
        Parameters:
        taskMap - is the taskMap whether maps from taskID to Task, which contains information about each task.

      • initialize

        private void initialize()
        Method that runs when the view has been initialized see JavaFX documentation, this will set up all of the timers and other variables that are needed to start GUI functionality.

      • start

        private void start()
        Method that will update the view by polling the algorithm, it will also update the view to disable buttons and such thus that the current state of the scheduler is reflected in the view.

      • stop

        private void stop()
        Method that runs when the algorithm has been prematurely terminated, this method will stop all the timers such that the view reflects the current state of the scheduler.

      • write

        private void write()

      • showAlert

        private void showAlert(java.lang.String image,
                       java.lang.String title,
                       java.lang.String body)
        Method that is used to show an alert to the user.
        Parameters:
        image - The image in the body of the alert
        title - The title of the alert.
        body - The text is the body of the alert.

      • finish

        private void finish()
        Method that runs when the algorithm has successfully completed, will stop the timers such that the view reflects the current state of the scheduler.

      • startTimer

        private void startTimer()
        Method that starts the timer on the GUI

      • initChart

        private void initChart(javafx.scene.chart.NumberAxis x,
                       javafx.scene.chart.NumberAxis y,
                       javafx.scene.chart.LineChart chart,
                       com.sun.management.OperatingSystemMXBean bean,
                       long start,
                       java.util.function.Function<com.sun.management.OperatingSystemMXBean,java.lang.Double> valueFunction)
        Method that will initialize a time ticking chart with a value to be with the system
        Parameters:
        x - xAxis of Chart
        y - yAxis of Chart
        chart - the chart to initialize
        bean - System Bean
        start - Start time
        valueFunction - method that returns the value to be used in the load chart on the y axis.

      • initLoadCharts

        private void initLoadCharts()
        Initializes the CPU and Memory charts

      • getCpuUsage

        private double getCpuUsage(com.sun.management.OperatingSystemMXBean bean)
        Returns current system CPU usage
        Parameters:
        bean - the OS bean that is used to obtain the CPU usage values.
        Returns:
        the CPU usage as a percentage

      • getMemoryUsage

        private double getMemoryUsage(com.sun.management.OperatingSystemMXBean bean)
        Returns current system memory usage by this application
        Parameters:
        bean - the OS bean that is used to obtain the memory usage values.
        Returns:
        the Memory usage as a percentage

      • initBarChart

        private void initBarChart()
        Initializes the bar chart

      • updateBarChart

        private void updateBarChart(int[][] schedule)
        Updates the bar chart based off the current most optimal schedule
        Parameters:
        schedule - schedule for bar chart for which bar chart is to be modelled

      • setNodeStyle

        private void setNodeStyle(javafx.scene.Node node,
                          java.lang.Integer[] data)
        Paints a bar chart node to be beautiful :)
        Parameters:
        node - JFX Node
        data - Data to paint the node with
